Description: Rim sherd of Attic black-figured pottery overlap Siana cup; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed below; top of rim glazed; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of head of clothed male figure with added red on hair and beard to left.
Producer name: Attributed to: Painter of Boston C.A.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 373, no. B510)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0373) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
